definition: variant of 裝潢|装潢[zhuang1 huang2]
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: The curtains do not match with the decoration.
sentences.chinese: 窗簾與室內裝璜不相配。

sentences.english: The secret to light decorating is finding the right balance for the room.
sentences.chinese: 燈飾裝璜的祕訣在於找到合乎居室的平衡點。

sentences.english: Picture windows with many combinations of ventilating sash are also furnished in aluminum.
sentences.chinese: 帶許多通風窗組合的觀景窗也用鋁裝璜。

sentences.english: A few large hotels maintain their own workshops for such tasks as carpentry and upholstering.
sentences.chinese: 個別大旅館有專門的木工車間和裝璜車間。

sentences.english: Homestar Decoration Engineering Co. , LTD was established in 2000.
sentences.chinese: 家世達裝璜工程有限公司，成立於2000年。

sentences.english: Landlord right to retain tenant trade fixtures.
sentences.chinese: 房東保留營業裝璜的權力。

sentences.english: Once we settled on the styling, we had to make some basic decisions about the interior .
sentences.chinese: 式樣一定下來，我們就要對內部裝璜作出基本的決定。

sentences.english: Beside the tower lies the cathedral, with a gloriou s interior.
sentences.chinese: 位於鐘塔旁的大教堂內部裝璜高雅。

sentences.english: Our products are widely used in commercial units, hotels, boutiques, jewellery shop and interior decoration.
sentences.chinese: 廣泛應用於商場，酒店，精品店，珠寶店及室內裝璜。

sentences.english: They use their ability in advertising, interior decoration, or some similar job.
sentences.chinese: 他們把能力用在廣告，室內裝璜或某種類似的工作上。

definition: full moon/first full moon after birth (i.e. entering the second month)
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
